Representations in a request (e.g. PUT or POST) and representations in  
a =
response (e.g. GET or a PUT) need not be absolutely the same. HTTP  
server=
s are not databases that blindly store the data. Using PUT to  
update the =
mutable parts of a resource is perfectly okay. At least, I  
don't see anyt=
hing that breaks HTTP.

Subbu
